snippet: As the nation lags in meeting its goals and businesses complain about global competition, Chancellor Angela Merkel promised to redouble efforts to reach her goal by 2020.
abstract: Germany unveils plan to cut enough carbon dioxide emissions to triple reductions from current levels, which are far behind reduction target set for 2020; Germany has fallen short in its ambitious goals and is now burning more coal than at any point since 1990.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: As the nation lags in meeting its goals and businesses complain about global competition, Chancellor Angela Merkel promised to redouble efforts to reach her goal by 2020.

headline.main: Missing Its Own Goals, Germany Renews Effort to Cut Carbon Emissions
headline.print_headline: Missing Its Own Goals, Germany Renews Effort to Cut Carbon Emissions
